speaker: Lune
line: Maelle, you should do the honours.

speaker: Maelle
line: We can– We can do this. For Gustave.

speaker: Verso
line: I don’t understand, the Gradient Attacks should work– Wait, Maelle.

speaker: Maelle
line: I don’t think this is the–

speaker: Verso
line: This might be our only chance.

speaker: Lune
line: We are… inside the Monolith… What was that thing? Why did it help us inside?

speaker: Maelle
line: Up– Up there– She’s– The Paintress– She’s up there.

speaker: Maelle
line: I don’t know, but I can sense– The real Paintress– Her heart is above us somewhere.

speaker: Lune
line: I guess we head up then.

speaker: Lune
line: Teaching her children to paint, huh…

speaker: Maelle
line: We’re inside her mind… These are memories…

speaker: Maelle
line: The Chroma here… I can “read” it.

speaker: Verso
line: Yeah, fine. Let’s keep moving, we’re almost at the top.

speaker: Renoir
line: She’s not the only one who grieves. The pain of losing you… She made me inherit it. Punishment, perhaps, for not being there when it mattered. I refuse to lose my son.

speaker: Verso
line: You lost me years ago. And I lost you.

speaker: Renoir
line: So you leave us no choice? How are you different from her in doing this?

speaker: Renoir
line: So trust me. We are your family.

speaker: Renoir
line: If saving you means losing you, then so be it.

speaker: Verso
line: We only need to incapacitate him.

speaker: Maelle
line: We’ll find a way to kill him.

speaker: Renoir
line: Remember who your REAL family is. It’s not her. It’s your sister. Your mother. Me. WE are your family. You would condemn us all to die, for what? Who do you really save with your sacrifice?

speaker: Verso
line: You’re too drunk on your own illusion to understand.

speaker: Renoir
line: Then let us celebrate the second destruction of the Dessendre family. At long last, we meet. This is all you have left of your son. Destroying it won’t bring your wife back. It will only destroy the last tie you have to each other. I love them too.

speaker: Lune
line: Hey. How did you do that?

speaker: Maelle
line: I’m not sure. The Curator– I felt it–

speaker: Maelle
line: I don’t know– uh. I think so? Yeah, yeah I think I can.

speaker: Sciel
line: What did Renoir mean? The things he said to the Curator.

speaker: Lune
line: Yeah. Behind this door is the future of Lumière. What every expedition has worked towards. I have trust… in us.

speaker: Maelle
line: She’s there– I can feel her.

speaker: Monoco
line: We need to be as prepared as possible. Once we go up, there’s no turning back.

speaker: Lune
line: Renoir. He mentioned the Curator’s wife. She’s the Paintress?

speaker: The Paintress
line: You’ve come– back– But the fire– Are you really here? Or is He–? Oh… is he playing tricks again? Alicia…

speaker: Maelle
line: My face? What about my face? Are you going to burn it again?

speaker: Sciel
line: And Maelle reminds you of her. The daughter you lost.

speaker: Verso
line: Yes. You need to go home.

speaker: The Paintress
line: This is another trick. She’s not Alicia. You are not my Verso.

speaker: The Paintress
line: No, no, you are HIS creations, not mine. You will not take this Canvas from me!

speaker: Verso
line: This is what we created the Expeditions for.

speaker: The Paintress
line: How cruel of your father to use you like this.

speaker: Verso
line: Merde! I don’t like this. Esquie! Look what I found.

speaker: The Paintress
line: Renoir can grieve however he likes. But I get to grieve my own way.

speaker: Verso
line: Rest now. Things’ll be better soon.

speaker: Monoco
line: It’s done. You’re free. You are all free.

speaker: Sciel
line: Yeah. And I’m pretty sure Gustave’s watching over us. Hey, come– Wanna plant it?

speaker: Lune
line: Though presumably, there will be no one coming after, right?

speaker: Sciel
line: Monoco. You’ve been extra quiet since we got to the Monolith.

speaker: Maelle
line: What now? We go back to Lumière and… life goes on?

speaker: Sciel
line: Yeah. Decades and decades in front of us. Guess this is how it feels to be immortal. What do we do now with all this time?

speaker: Lune
line: The Expedition might be over… But we’re not done yet. There are so many questions left to answer.

speaker: Alicia
line: Brother, I tire of the conflicts and deceptions that plague our family and theirs. So I entrust you with this letter. Whether you give it to her is up to you. I’m at peace with what’s to come. When the time comes, I hope you will be too.

speaker: Alicia
line: Maelle. It’s a strange feeling, watching you with my brother. Laughing and smiling. Without the scars or the memories that afflict me. Alicia – as she was meant to be. Not this painted version that I am. My family, a facsimile of yours. And this world, a mirror. Painted by our mother, the Paintress, to stave off her grief.

speaker: Alicia
line: Seeing your expedition through would plunge us all into the abyss. For in ridding the world of the Paintress… You’d lose the sole force standing against the one who would erase us. The one who invokes the flowers of the Gommage. An act of love. For he does love her. Your Father.

speaker: Alicia
line: On her Monolith, she paints a warning for us all. Of the few she can save as her power wanes. We all wish for our families to thrive. Your family, however, believes only one can survive. But perhaps you’ll find another way. You who have lived amongst us. Perhaps you differ from your father and your father, as I differ from mine. Your mother paints life. While your father, death. What will you paint?
